heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (235°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.0°C) and outside temperature (down 2.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (up 10 mbar), rainfall (up 0.4 mm), and cloud levels (down 140 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 833 m) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 140.2m higher than yesterday, 737.6m lower than the past week, 833.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 568m to a maximum of 931m, averaging 869.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1607.3m and 1703.0m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (91%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
